responseA: The label features a coat of arms with what appears to be a griffin on either side. Griffins are mythical creatures with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle. There are also stylized depictions of vines or plant tendrils around the griffins, which is common in heraldry. I am very certain (1) that these interpretations are accurate based on the visible elements and common design practices for wine labels and coats of arms.
